row.col: Please this article or section. Help improve this article by adding . (July 2008)''

bdy.p: AdRem NetCrunch is a commercial software solution for agentless, cross-platform network monitoring developed by AdRem Software, Inc.

The program monitors 65 network services, Windows applications; Windows,
Linux , NetWare systems and SNMP (v1-3) devices without agents; centralizes fault management by collecting and alerting on events from sources including Windows Event Log, syslogs, and SNMP traps; presents physical and logical network topology as automatically updated dynamic graphical views.

sec.p: AdRem NetCrunch key features:
Auto Discovery - initial and scheduled discovery and classification of network resources
Network Views - physical and logical network topology including predefined views like: IP networks, Routing Map, Physical Segments, Servers, Maps with Issues, and others.

Event Management - events from Windows,
Syslog
and SNMP traps
Monitoring Policies - sets of rules defining events to be monitored and data to be collected for later reporting, including predefined policies for:

1. Operating System -
Active Directory
, Network Services Health, Security Audit, Terminal Services, NetWare, Windows NT Server,
Linux .

2. SNMP - Network - Alcatel OmniSwitch,
Nortel .

3. SNMP - Operating System - IBM AIX, AS/400,
Linux , Novell Netware.

4. SNMP - Hardware - APC PowerChute,
Compaq Insight Manager, Dell OpenManage, IBM Director.
5. MIB-II host resources

6. Application - APC Windows Events, ARCServe, CA eTrust Alert Manager,
Microsoft Exchange Server 5.5/2000/2003, IIS 5.0/6.0, ISA Server 2000, ISA Server 2004, Lotus Notes 6,
McAfee AlertManager,
Norton AntiVirus Corporate Edition,
Oracle
9i,
Sophos Enterprise Manager, SQL Server 7.0/2000,
Trend Micro ServerProtect, Veritas Backup Exec.
Availability Monitoring - network devices and services ( HTTP, POP3, SMTP, etc.)
Performance Monitoring - real-time statistics, multi-server charts, and performance trends (devices, systems, and applications)
Long-term Trend Analysis – reports generated on demand or delivered on schedule via email.
Remote Access –access via web browser, alerts via remote desktop notification client
AdRem NetCrunch runs on Microsoft Windows XP SP2, Windows Vista SP1 (except Home editions), and Windows Server 2003 x32 or x64.
There are two editions: Premium and Premium XE. The Premium XE edition is designed for large networks and intended to run on a dedicated Windows 2003 server.

Common Premium XE Usage Scenarios include:
Network with more than a 1000 nodes for availability monitoring
Network with more than a 1000 network services for availability monitoring
Network with more than a 100 servers and routers for performance monitoring
Network with sub networks
Network with external servers connected over WAN Links
Network with CISCO or Nortel switches
MS SQL, Exchange application performance monitoring and trending
Multithreading - NetCrunch Premium XE uses multithreading to take advantage of multi-core x64 machines’ performance characteristics.
Prioritized monitoring - the program automatically sets up node monitoring order and time upon monitoring dependencies hierarchy.
Event Suppression - in case of failure of an intermediate node, the program suppresses alerts from nodes located beyond that node.
